row.entry: This action automatically adds a version.

This action converts .pdf or .doc file types to plain text.

step.para: Complete the required fields in the form for the selected action.

row.entry: The Id of action. This field is created automatically and can not be modified.
The name of this action. This name is internal to the JCR explorer.

Select the life-cycle for this action. The action will be executed depending on the life-cycle:
'Add': The action will be executed to a new document, but not to a subfolder when the document or the subfolder is created in the folder in which an action has been added to. It's also applied to a new document in the subfolder of the folder.
'Modify': the action will be executed when a folder /node is modified.
'User action': The action is executed when right-clicking on the folder and then selecting the action.
'Remove': The action will be executed to a document, but not to a subfolder in the folder when the document or the subfolder is moved.
'Schedule': the action is done at specific time. There are 2 schedule lifeless types: period and cron. (See more about Schedule life-cycle).
If you need the same action to be executed in several life-cycles, you have to create several actions.

step.para: Click Save to commit the action.

section.para: All actions of a node are listed in the Available Actions tab.

If an action added with the life-cycle 'user action', it will be applied for the current node. And an action added with other lifestyles, it will be applied for the child nodes.

Enable this function by navigating to Administration > Content Presentation >Manage Views. See to know how to add the Publish Content button to the tabs on the action bar in Content Explorer.

section.title: Show Drives
section.para: This function enables you to show or hide all the drives in Content Explorer.

To show drives, click the
[ Show/Hide Drives ]
button on the action bar.

To hide drives, click the
[ Show/Hide Drives ]
button again.

section.title: Show JCR Structure
section.para: This function allows you to view nodes in documents in a tree structure.

step.title: Show the JCR structure
step.para: Select a document.
Select the Info tab.

Click the
[ Show/Hide Like JCR Structure ]
button.

Click the
disk
icon to save the view.
The following information message will appear:

step.title: Hide the JCR structure
step.para: Select a document that is showing the JCR structure.

Click the
[ Show/Hide Like JCR Structure ]
button again.

section.title: Tag Documents
section.para: A tag is a (relevant) keyword or term associated with or assigned to a piece of information (a picture, a geographic map, a blog entry, a video clip etc.), thus describing the item and enabling keyword-based classification and search of information.

procedure.title: Add a new tag for a document

step.para: Select a document that you want to add tags.

Click the
[ Tagging this document ]
button on the Action bar. The Tag Manager will be displayed:

row.entry: The tag names that users want to add tags for documents.

To classify tags. There are four tag types: private, public, group, site. Currently, the two first types are activated(Private: a user who create tags can view and edit tags; public: all users can view and edit tags).
To list all tags of a document after you click the Add Tags button.

step.para: Input a value for the Tag names field. A document can be added several tags at a time. To do that, input all tag names in the Tag names field and separate by “,”.
Select a value for the Tag Scopes field.
Click Add Tags to accept, or Close to quit. Only you can see this tag in this document.

Click the
trash can
icon to delete tags.
Select a document with tags that you want to delete the tags.

Click the
[ Tagging this document ]
button on the action bar to open the Tag Manager form.

Click the
trash can
corresponding to the tags you want to delete.
Click OK on the confirmation message to delete the tags.

section.title: Upload files into folders
section.para: This function supports you to upload a file from your machine. All file types can be uploaded. The uploaded file's name must not include some special characters (! @ $ % & [ ])

procedure.title: Do the following to upload file into folder:

step.para: Select the folder that you want to upload a file into from the left/right panel
Select the Actions tab to show some actions on the Action bar.

Click the
[ Upload ]
button on the Action bar to open the Upload a file form:
Browse and select a file on your computer by clicking the Browse... button. The selected file name will be displayed in the Select a file field.

If you want to upload multi files at the same time, click the
plus
icon to open more forms to upload more files:

The
trash can
icon closes the upload file form.

You can change the uploaded file by clicking the
trash can
icon and select Browse... again to select another one.

By default, the name of the uploaded file will be kept as original but if you want to change, you can type the new name in the Name field, this field is not required. The new name must not contain special characters: ! @ $ % & [ ].

You can click the
plus
icon next to the List Taxonomy field to add categories for this file:

Select categories by clicking the
green tick
icon. Click the plus to open child nodes of categories.

note.para:
You can add more categories for a file by clicking the
plus
icon again to open the Add Categories form.

Click the
trash can
icon to delete a category in Upload a file form.
You also manage categories which were added to files by using the Manage Categories function. See .

step.para: Complete uploading file by clicking Save.
After being saved, the main information of the uploaded file will be displayed:

Click the
pencil
icon to see more details of its external metadata information. The List external metadata tab will be enable and you can input value in this tab.
Click Save to accept changes or Cancel to quit without any changes.
Data can be added for the uploaded file. Check the checkbox, then click Add, or Cancel to quit without adding anything.

The new metadata are displayed in the External Metadatas list and you also can edit it by clicking the
pencil
icon.
Click Close to quit the Uploaded information form.
After being uploaded, the tree is displayed in the left panel:

note.title: File Size Limits
note.para: The size of the uploaded file depends on the size limit of the uploaded file that you set up in the 'Edit' mode of Content Explorer. If your file size exceeds the limit, a pop-up message will appears to alert you.

section.title: View Metadata
section.para: This function allows you to view the metadata attached to File nodes, Podcast nodes, File Plan child nodes and uploaded file nodes (nt:file nodes)

step.para: Select an appropriate (nt:file) node.

Click the
[ View Metadatas ]
button. The View Metadata form appears:
Click the Add/Edit button at the bottom of the View Metadata form to add metadata.

Complete the desired fields in the Add/Edit Properties form. Click the
plus
icon to add further metadata.
Click Save to commit the new metadata values.

section.title: View Node Types
section.para: To view detailed information about a node:

step.para: Select a node that you want to view its detailed information.

Click the
[ View Node Types ]
button to view detailed information about the selected node.
Click the tabs at the top of the form to view categorized information.

section.title: View Permissions
section.para: This function enables an administrator to manage the permissions for nodes.

step.para: Select a node.

Click the
[ View Permissions ]
button. The Permissions Management form appears.

section.para: With the Permissions Management form open you can perform the following actions:

step.title: To add permission for specific users
step.para:
Click the
"Select user"
icon next to the User Or Group field.

Click the
green tick
beside the users you want to grant permissions to.

step.title: To select users from a specific group
step.para: Enter a group name in the Group field at the top of the form (for example; /platform/users). All users in the nominated group will be displayed.
Or;

Click the
magnifying glass
icon beside the Group field to open a form that lists groups and their sub-groups. Select a sub-group to add all users in that sub-group.

step.title: To search for a user
step.para:
Select an information parameter (User Name, First Name, Last Name, Email) from the drop down menu in the other field at the top of the page and enter the information into the text box. Click the
magnifying glass
to search for users that match that information.

step.title: To add permissions based on memberships
step.para:
Click the
"Select membership"
icon next to the User Or Group field.
The Select membership form that appears allows you to select users by membership. Select a group on the left pane and then select membership types on the right.

step.title: To add all users/groups with read access
step.para:
Click the
"Select everyone"
icon next to the User Or Group field.
Select the permission you want to grant the chosen users or groups by ticking the corresponding check boxes beside the rights you want to add.
Click Save to commit the changes. The new permissions will appear in the permissions table above.
Select the permission of a user or a group in the table of list permissions.

Click the
pencil
icon.
Change the permissions as desired.
Click Save to commit the changed permissions.
Select the permission of a user or a group in the table of list permissions.

Click the
trash can
icon.
Click OK in the confirmation message to remove the permission.

section.title: View Properties
section.para: This function allows users to review all the properties and values of a node. It can also be used to add values to a node.

step.para: Select the node that you want to review or add values to.

Click the
[ View Node Properties ]
button to show the Properties Management form:
This form has two tabs:

listitem.para: This tab displays all properties and values for the selected node.
Select this tab to review the properties for the selected node without making any changes.
This tab contains fields to add new properties to the selected node.
Select this node if you want to make changes to the properties of the selected node.

step.title: To add new properties:
step.para: Select the namespace for the property.
Enter a name for the new property in the Name field.
Select a Type for the property from the drop-down menu for the field Type.
Enter a value for the property in the Value.

To add multiple new values, click the
plus
icon and repeat the above steps.

To remove a value, click the
trash can
.
Click Save to commit the new values or Reset to clear any modified fields.

section.para: After you commit new properties, you will be returned to the Properties tab. The newly added values will be displayed.

In this form you can edit a property by clicking the
pencil
icon or delete it by clicking the
trash can
.

section.title: View Relations
section.para: This function shows documents related to a selected node.

step.title: To View Relations
step.para:
Select a node then click the
[ Show/Hide Relations ]
button. Documents related to the selected node will be shown in the sidebar.
If the node does not have any related documents the message No related document will appear instead.

step.title: To Hide Relations
step.para:
Click the
[ Show/Hide Relations ]
button again to hide relations.

section.title: Vote
section.para: This function is used to vote for a document (Note: you cannot vote for a File Plan document).

step.para: Open the document you want to vote for.

Click the
[ Vote for document ]
button on the action bar.
The Vote Document form will appear:
Rate the document by clicking on the appropriate star level for your vote:

section.para: After a vote has been added, the rating will appear at the bottom of the document:

section.title: Watch Documents
section.para: By using this function, whenever a change is made on the document, there will be a notification message sent to your email address. To receive that email, you must configure in your mail server.

step.para: Select the document you want to watch.
The Watching Document form will appear. Click the Watch button to finish.

section.para:
To stop watching a document, select the document and click the
eye
icon.
A message will appear for you to confirm the action.
